author: .paulharris
content: depends how you want to contribute, you could also find a client in a language you know, and contrib to some of their easy fixes...

author: .paulharris
content: eg. if you like java, you'd probably look at teku and find some 'good first issues'

author: perelyn
content:
I'm participating in EPF and I wish to contribute to Stokes's projects https://github.com/eth-protocol-fellows/cohort-three/blob/master/projects/project-ideas.md#cl--mev-software 

My understanding of the consensus layer is not that deep so I want to improve it so I can be helpful

author: .paulharris
content: oh great! The EPF has a kickoff soon, so we can help there too... getting across all core devs can help, but also the spec, and there's a book in progress https://eth2book.info/latest/ which has a lot of information in it..

author: .paulharris
content: for me i tend to look at code early, so that's why i suggested finding a CL client that's written in a language you're comfortable with ðŸ™‚

author: potuz
content: <@539495253418180618> the measurement I made for shuffling changes due to balances changing was for Goerli which is much more likely to happen than in mainnet

author: potuz
content: I only realized this late last night. It may well be that the shuffling almost never changes in mainnet.

author: perelyn
content: Thanks, That means I'll have to look at lighthouse's code
